member.name: T:Racon.CGenericFederate
member.summary: Presents an extension point for application-specific federates. The generic federate defines the abstraction and is implemented as a wrapper façade class.

remarks.para: This class is the base wrapper for the RTI-specific classes (i.e. the RTI Layer) and the main extension point. This class should be inherited by a class that encapsulates the federate-specific data.

Most federate developers (mainly students or inexperienced simulation developers) are not interested in the details of this subsystem, which complicate their implementation; instead their only need is to initialize the federation ex-ecution. Hence, the generic federate provides a higher-level interface. The developer calls only the method (InitializeFederation) rather than calling related series of low-level RTI methods (such as; create federation, join federation, create regions, and publish and subscribe classes). One of the rationales here is to simplify the interface for novice HLA users by hiding the perplexing RTI class relationships. On the other hand, the low-level RTI methods can still be called using the CRtiAmb.

RACoN provides notifications about HLA-related services to the application-specific federate by using events (event-based notification). Therefore, an application-specific federate can handle events triggered from the commu-nication layer by overriding the event handlers that are subscribed by the base federate in order to customize their RTI-related behaviors (delegated event handling). For example, when a new object is discovered, the RACoN assembly raises a new object discovered event. The application-specific fed-erate that hooks the event, is notified that the event has been triggered. Then, the application-specific federate can take action such as adding the new ob-ject to its scene graph or creating a local substitute for that object. .NET event handling structures are used for implementing events and event handling mechanisms. Events are categorized according to their initiators, as follows:

list.item: RTI-initiated events generated by federate ambassador callbacks such as an object discovered event.
Federate-initiated events generated by the RTI ambassador such as a federate joined event.
RACoN events generated by the generic federate such as a feder-ate state changed event.

remarks.para: The federate-initiated and RACON event handlers are executed as soon as they are raised, but, the RTI-initiated events (callbacks from the RTI to the federate ambassador) are queued as events for processing at the end of each simulation cycle. They are executed when the federate run method is called. The federate Run() method must be called in the main (simulation loop) of the application.

member.name: P:Racon.CGenericFederate.RtiAmb
member.summary: The reference for internal RTI ambassador. This reference can be used to access internal RTI ambassador interface

member.name: P:Racon.CGenericFederate.FederateState
member.summary: Current federate state. When it is set, it raises Event.

member.name: P:Racon.CGenericFederate.FederationExecutionState
member.summary: Current federation execution state. When it is set, it raises Event.

member.name: P:Racon.CGenericFederate.StatusMessage
member.summary: The log message RACoN. When it is set, it raises Event.

member.name: P:Racon.CGenericFederate.LogLevel
member.summary: Current Log Level. When it is set, it reports version, RTI native library, and current log level via .

member.name: P:Racon.CGenericFederate.RTILibrary
member.summary: Current type of native RTI Library. It is set via constructor only, switches accordingly.

member.name: P:Racon.CGenericFederate.FederationExecution
member.summary: The federation execution that this federate will interact (e.g. create, join etc.).

member.name: P:Racon.CGenericFederate.Time
member.summary: The federate logical time. A point in HLA time axis.

member.name: M:Racon.CGenericFederate.OnStatusMessageChanged
member.summary: Wraps the event in a protected virtual method to enable derived classes to raise the event.

member.summary: Wraps the event in a protected virtual method to enable derived classes to raise the event.

member.name: M:Racon.CGenericFederate.OnFederationStateChanged(Racon.CFederationStateEventArgs)
member.summary: Wraps the event in a protected virtual method to enable derived classes to raise the event.

member.name: M:Racon.CGenericFederate.#ctor(Racon.RTILibraryType)
member.param: Native RTI library reference. Default is RTILibraryType.HLA1516e_OpenRti

member.name: M:Racon.CGenericFederate.FdAmb_FederationExecutionsReported(System.Object,Racon.RtiLayer.HlaFederationManagementEventArgs)
member.summary: IEEE1516.1-2010 4.8: Federation Executions Reported. Federate ambassador callback to get the federation executions

member.name: M:Racon.CGenericFederate.Log_ListChanged(System.Object,System.Collections.Specialized.NotifyCollectionChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Whenever a new log entry happens, this is used to check to report the message according to log level

member.name: M:Racon.CGenericFederate.Run
member.summary: Method to tick and process the callbacks.
member.remarks: This method is called to tick and process the callbacks. Typically, it is called in main simuation loop.

member.name: M:Racon.CGenericFederate.SetSom(Racon.ObjectModel.CObjectModel)
member.summary: Sets the simulation object model for federate.
member.returns: True if method call is succesfull.

member.name: M:Racon.CGenericFederate.InitializeFederation(Racon.CFederationExecution)
member.summary: Initializes federation execution: (1) Connects. (2) Creates federation execution. (3) Joins federation execution. (4) Creates regions. (5) Declares capability.
member.returns: returns True/False.
member.remarks: High level interface. This method creates federation if it is first one, joins federation, creates regions, and publishes and subscribes classes.

member.name: M:Racon.CGenericFederate.FinalizeFederation(Racon.CFederationExecution,Racon.ResignAction)
member.summary: Finalizes federation execution with user selected Resign Action: (1) Resign federation execution (2) Try to destroy federation execution (3) Disconnect
member.returns: True if method call is succesfull.
member.remarks: Higher level interface. This method resigns federation, destroys federation if it is last one.

member.name: M:Racon.CGenericFederate.Connect(Racon.CallbackModel,System.String)
member.param: Connection paramaters in form of "protocol"://"ip":"port". For example: rti://127.0.0.1:12345
member.returns: returns True/False.
member.remarks: This method is for IEEE1516-2010 compatiblity. Sets the federate status as CONNECTED.

member.name: M:Racon.CGenericFederate.Disconnect
member.remarks: This method is for IEEE1516-2010 compatiblity. Sets the federate status as NOTCONNECTED.

member.name: M:Racon.CGenericFederate.CreateFederationExecution(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.param: Optional logical time implementation. If not provided, the RTI provided HLAfloat64Time representation of logical time shall be used.
member.returns: True if method call is succesfull.
member.remarks: This method creates federation execution.

member.param: Optional logical time implementation. If not provided, the RTI provided HLAfloat64Time representation of logical time shall be used.

member.name: M:Racon.CGenericFederate.CreateFederationExecutionWithMIM(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.String,System.String)
member.summary: IEEE1516.1-2010 4.5: Creates a federation execution with multiple FOM modules and a MIM module
member.param: Optional MIM designator. The RTI shall load the supplied MIM if specified; otherwise, it shall automatically load the standard MIM. the supplied MIM module designator shall not be “HLAstandardMIM.”
Optional logical time implementation. If not provided, the RTI provided HLAfloat64Time representation of logical time shall be used.

The FOM module designators are optional and are used to provide additional FDD. The contents cannot conflict with the current FDD specified in federa-tion execution creation.
member.returns: True if method call is succesfull.
member.remarks: Federate joins a federation execution.

member.param: Name must be unique in the federation execution.

member.name: M:Racon.CGenericFederate.DeclareCapability
member.summary: Declares capability of a federate in terms of Publish/Subscribe: (1) Enables object class relevance advisory switch. (2) Gets object class and attribute handles. (3) Publishes/subscribes all the object classes in SOM according to their PS status. (4) Enables interaction relevance advisory switch. (5) Gets interaction class and parameter handles. (6) Publishes/subscribes all the interaction classes in SOM according to their PS status.
member.returns: True if method call is succesfull.

member.returns: Returns true/false.

member.name: M:Racon.CGenericFederate.UnconditionalAttributeOwnershipDivestiture(Racon.RtiLayer.HlaObject,System.Collections.Generic.List{Racon.RtiLayer.HlaAttribute})
member.remarks: Releases ownership of a specified set of instance attributes for a specified object instance. The attributes immediately become unowned and are available for acquisition by any federate.

member.name: M:Racon.CGenericFederate.NegotiatedAttributeOwnershipDivestiture``1(Racon.RtiLayer.HlaObject,System.Collections.Generic.List{Racon.RtiLayer.HlaAttribute},``0)
member.remarks: Initiates an attempt to release ownership of a specified set of instance-attributes for a specified object instance. In the absence of an acquiring federate, the instance-attributes will continue to be owned by the divesting federate.

member.name: M:Racon.CGenericFederate.NegotiatedAttributeOwnershipDivestiture``1(Racon.RtiLayer.HlaObject,``0)
member.remarks: Initiates an attempt to release ownership of all instance-attributes for a specified object instance. In the absence of an acquiring federate, the instance-attributes will continue to be owned by the divesting federate.

member.name: M:Racon.CGenericFederate.AttributeOwnershipAcquisition``1(Racon.RtiLayer.HlaObject,System.Collections.Generic.List{Racon.RtiLayer.HlaAttribute},``0)
member.remarks: Initiates an attempt to acquire a specified set of attributes of an object instance.

member.name: M:Racon.CGenericFederate.AttributeOwnershipAcquisition``1(Racon.RtiLayer.HlaObject,``0)
member.remarks: Initiates an attempt to acquire all attributes of an object instance.

member.name: M:Racon.CGenericFederate.AttributeOwnershipAcquisitionIfAvailable(Racon.RtiLayer.HlaObject,System.Collections.Generic.List{Racon.RtiLayer.HlaAttribute})
member.remarks: Initiates an attempt to acquire a set of instanceattributes of an object instance. Only instance-attributes that exist in the federation but are currently unowned will be acquired.

member.summary: IEEE1516.1-2010 10.35: Enable Attribute Relevance Advisory Switch enables the generation of the Attribute Relevance Advisory Switch service advisory

member.summary: Enable Object Class Relevance Advisory Switch enables the generation of the Start/Stop Registration For Object Class service advisory

member.name: M:Racon.CGenericFederate.DisableAttributeRelevanceAdvisorySwitch
member.summary: Disable Attribute Relevance Advisory Switch disables the generation of the Attribute Relevance Advisory Switch service advisory

member.name: M:Racon.CGenericFederate.EvokeCallback(System.Double)
member.summary: Evoke Callback this service invocation shall wait for the duration indicated by this argument. Default is 0.01 sec (1 msec)

member.name: M:Racon.CGenericFederate.EvokeMultipleCallbacks(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Instructs the RTI that the invoking federate is prepared to receive multiple federate callbacks.The service shall continue to process available callbacks until the minimum specified wall-clock time. At that wall-clock time, if there are no additional callbacks to be delivered to the federate, the service shall complete. If, after the minimum specified wall-clock time, there continue to be callbacks, the RTI shall continue to deliver those callbacks until the maximum specified wall-clock time is exceeded. Min amount of wallclock time. Max amount of wallclock time.

member.name: M:Racon.CGenericFederate.Tick
member.summary: Tick() is alias for Evoke Callback

member.name: M:Racon.CGenericFederate.Tick(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Tick(min, max) is alias for Evoke Multiple Callbacks the minimum time interval (in wall clock seconds) to spend in tick() the maximum time interval (in wall clock seconds) after which tick() will not begin execution of any additional processing

member.name: T:Racon.CFederateStateEventArgs
member.summary: Encapsulates event arguments for Federate State changed event.
member.remarks: This class inherits the EventArgs class. It is used in delegates (function pointers) and event handlers (event handling methods).

member.name: T:Racon.CFederationExecution
member.remarks: This class captures the all federation execution related data such as the name of the federation execution from the view of a joined federate.

member.name: P:Racon.CFederationExecution.FDD
member.summary: FDD (Federation Document Data) / FED (Federation Execution Data) file name with full path

member.name: P:Racon.CFederationExecution.FederateName
member.summary: Name of the Joined Federate in the Federation Execution

member.name: P:Racon.CFederationExecution.FederateType
member.summary: Type of the Joined Federate in the Federation Execution

member.name: P:Racon.CFederationExecution.ConnectionSettings
member.summary: Connection settings - local Settings Designator in Connect() call

member.name: T:Racon.CFederationStateEventArgs
member.summary: Encapsulates event arguments for Federation State changed event.
member.remarks: This class inherits the EventArgs class. It is used in delegates and event handlers.

member.name: P:Racon.Logger.LogManager.LogLevel
member.summary: Current Log Level. When it is set, it reports version, RTI native library, and current log level via .

member.name: M:Racon.Logger.LogManager.Add(System.String,Racon.LogLevel)

member.name: M:Racon.Logger.LogManager.ToString
member.summary: Dumbs all log entries in form of a string

member.name: F:Racon.ObjectModel.CRegion.Extents
member.summary: Extent List - It should be defined and added to list for each extent according to dimension count.

member.name: P:Racon.ObjectModel.CDimension.RtiAmb
member.summary: RtiAmb reference. If it is null, then Handle is -1.

member.name: M:Racon.ObjectModel.CDimension.#ctor(System.String,Racon.ObjectModel.CRoutingSpace)
member.summary: CDimension constructor. Dimension name must be the same with the one specified in FED/FDD.

member.name: T:Racon.ObjectModel.CRoutingSpace
member.summary: Represents a routing space. HLA3 specific.

member.name: M:Racon.ObjectModel.CRoutingSpace.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: CRoutingSpace. Name must be the same with specified in FED.

member.name: T:Racon.ObjectModel.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The HLA object model supports the construction of the simulation object model, which includes the HLA objects, interactions, and routing spaces (plus regions).
member.remarks: The routing space list is for backward compatibility and only used for HLA 1.3 federations. The data structure used for lists is the binding list (Bind-ingList) class, which is a generic collection class from .NET API.

member.name: M:Racon.ObjectModel.CObjectModel.AddToObjectModel(Racon.RtiLayer.HlaObjectClass)
member.summary: Adds an object class to object model.

member.name: M:Racon.ObjectModel.CObjectModel.AddToObjectModel(Racon.RtiLayer.HlaInteractionClass)
member.summary: Adds an interaction class to object model.

member.name: M:Racon.ObjectModel.CObjectModel.AddToObjectModel(Racon.RtiLayer.HlaDimension)
member.summary: Adds a dimension to object model.

member.name: M:Racon.ObjectModel.CObjectModel.AddToObjectModel(Racon.ObjectModel.CRoutingSpace)
member.summary: HLA13: Adds a routing space to object model.

member.name: T:Racon.Properties.Resources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:Racon.Properties.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:Racon.Properties.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:Racon.Properties.Resources.LibName
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to RACoN.

member.name: P:Racon.Properties.Resources.LibVersion
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to 0.0.2.4.

member.name: T:Racon.NamespaceDoc
member.remarks: RACoN deals with the HLA runtime infrastructure (RTI) level communication in order to access the federation-wide data (actually, the objects and interactions exchanged in federation). RTI is a middleware broker software that manages the federation execution and management, and object exchanges through a federation execution. The RACoN provides the .NET wrapper classes for the RTI and RTI-specific data structures. As it offers more maintainable, robust, and portable methods, developing an abstraction layer (wrapper) over RTI is a popular approach in many HLA-based projects.

member.name: T:Racon.RTILibraryType
member.summary: Represents type of RTI library wrapped by RACoN. Default is HLA13_DMSO

member.name: T:Racon.FederationExecutionStates
member.summary: Enum Federation States Fedexec typical cycle: Initial -> Created -> Initial

member.name: F:Racon.FederationExecutionStates.FEDEX_DOESNOTEXIST
member.summary: Federation is not available (does not exist). Either it is deleted or not created yet.

member.name: T:Racon.FederateStates
member.summary: Enum Federate States Federate typical cycle: Initial -> joined -> ready -> running -> Initial

member.name: F:Racon.FederateStates.NOTCONNECTED
member.summary: Federate is in initial state, not connected to the RTI

member.name: F:Racon.FederateStates.FREERUN
member.summary: Federate is joined to the federation, but it is not related to a specific scenario

member.name: F:Racon.FederateStates.SCENARIORUN_READY
member.summary: Scenario attributes are received/Updated and federate is ready for the scenario start.

member.name: F:Racon.FederateStates.SCENARIORUN_PLAYING
member.summary: Scenario began and the federate is ticking

member.name: F:Racon.FederateStates.NOTJOINED
member.summary: Federate is in initial state, connected to the RTI

member.name: T:Racon.ResignAction
member.summary: Represents Resign Actions - compatible with HLA1516.2010

member.name: F:Racon.ResignAction.UNCONDITIONALLY_DIVEST_ATTRIBUTES
member.summary: Unconditionally divest ownership of all owned instance attributes. Corresponds to RELEASE_ATTRIBUTES in HLA 13

member.name: F:Racon.ResignAction.DELETE_OBJECTS
member.summary: Delete all object instances for which the joined federate has the delete privilege. Corresponds to DELETE_OBJECTS

member.name: F:Racon.ResignAction.CANCEL_PENDING_OWNERSHIP_ACQUISITIONS
member.summary: Cancel all pending instance attribute ownership acquisitions. Corresponds to NO_ACTION in HLA 13

member.name: F:Racon.ResignAction.DELETE_OBJECTS_THEN_DIVEST
member.summary: Perform action 2) and then action 1). Corresponds to DELETE_OBJECTS_AND_RELEASE_ATTRIBUTES in HLA 13

member.name: F:Racon.ResignAction.CANCEL_THEN_DELETE_THEN_DIVEST
member.summary: Perform action 3), action 2), and then action 1). Corresponds to N/A - NO_ACTION in HLA 13

member.name: F:Racon.ResignAction.NO_ACTION
member.summary: Perform no actions. Corresponds to NO_ACTION in HLA 13
